Activin A.description: Activin A (Inhibin subunit beta A) is a TGF-beta superfamily member that regulates cell proliferation, differentiation, and apoptosis. It plays roles in reproductive biology, embryonic development, and inflammation.

BDNF.description: Brain-derived neurotrophic factor supports neuronal survival, growth, and synaptic plasticity. It is critical for learning, memory, and has been implicated in depression and neurodegenerative diseases.

BMP2.description: Bone morphogenetic protein 2 induces bone and cartilage formation. It plays key roles in skeletal development, fracture healing, and has therapeutic applications in orthopedic surgery.

BMP4.description: Bone morphogenetic protein 4 regulates embryonic development, including neural, bone, and tooth formation. It is important for ventral mesoderm patterning and hematopoiesis.

BMP6.description: Bone morphogenetic protein 6 regulates iron homeostasis through hepcidin induction. It also plays roles in bone development, chondrocyte differentiation, and ovarian function.

CD40L.description: CD40 ligand (CD154) is expressed on activated T cells and binds CD40 on antigen-presenting cells. It is essential for T cell-dependent B cell activation, immunoglobulin class switching, and germinal center formation.

CXCL12.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 12 (SDF-1) is a homeostatic chemokine that attracts lymphocytes and stem cells. It regulates hematopoiesis, organogenesis, and is involved in cancer metastasis.

EGF.description: Epidermal growth factor stimulates cell proliferation and differentiation by binding EGFR. It promotes wound healing, tissue regeneration, and is implicated in cancer progression.

FGF2.description: Fibroblast growth factor 2 (basic FGF) promotes angiogenesis, wound healing, and tissue repair. It supports stem cell self-renewal and is involved in tumor growth and metastasis.

GCSF.description: Granulocyte colony-stimulating factor stimulates neutrophil production and mobilizes hematopoietic stem cells. It is used clinically to treat neutropenia after chemotherapy.

GDF11.description: Growth differentiation factor 11 is a TGF-beta family member that regulates anterior-posterior patterning during development. It has been studied for potential anti-aging effects.

GMCSF.description: Granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor promotes myeloid cell differentiation and activation. It is important in inflammation and is targeted in autoimmune disease therapy.

HGF.description: Hepatocyte growth factor promotes cell proliferation, motility, and morphogenesis. It is important in liver regeneration, wound healing, and is implicated in cancer invasion and metastasis.

IFN1.description: Type I interferons (IFN-alpha/beta) are produced in response to viral infection. They induce antiviral states, activate immune cells, and regulate adaptive immune responses.

IFNG.description: Interferon gamma (IFN-γ) is a key cytokine for innate and adaptive immunity. It activates macrophages, enhances antigen presentation, and promotes Th1 responses against intracellular pathogens.

IFNL.description: Type III interferons (IFN-lambda) provide antiviral protection at epithelial barriers. They have similar functions to type I IFN but with more restricted receptor expression.

IL10.description: Interleukin-10 is an anti-inflammatory cytokine that limits immune responses. It inhibits pro-inflammatory cytokine production and is important for preventing autoimmunity and tissue damage.

IL12.description: Interleukin-12 promotes Th1 differentiation and IFN-γ production by T and NK cells. It is critical for cell-mediated immunity against intracellular pathogens and tumors.

IL13.description: Interleukin-13 promotes Th2 responses, IgE production, and mucus secretion. It is central to allergic inflammation and is a therapeutic target in asthma and atopic dermatitis.

IL15.description: Interleukin-15 supports NK cell and memory CD8 T cell development and homeostasis. It shares receptor components with IL-2 and is being developed for cancer immunotherapy.

IL17A.description: Interleukin-17A is the signature cytokine of Th17 cells. It promotes neutrophil recruitment and antimicrobial defense at mucosal surfaces, and is implicated in autoimmune diseases like psoriasis.

IL1A.description: Interleukin-1 alpha is a pro-inflammatory cytokine and alarmin released from damaged cells. It activates inflammation and can signal both extracellularly and intracellularly.

IL1B.description: Interleukin-1 beta is a potent pro-inflammatory cytokine activated by inflammasomes. It induces fever, activates endothelium, and is a key mediator in autoinflammatory diseases.

IL2.description: Interleukin-2 is essential for T cell proliferation, survival, and differentiation. It promotes both effector and regulatory T cell responses and is used in cancer immunotherapy.

IL21.description: Interleukin-21 regulates B cell differentiation, germinal center formation, and plasma cell development. It also enhances NK cell and CD8 T cell cytotoxicity.

IL22.description: Interleukin-22 promotes epithelial barrier function and antimicrobial defense. Produced by Th17/Th22 cells, it protects mucosal surfaces but can drive pathology in psoriasis.

IL27.description: Interleukin-27 has both pro- and anti-inflammatory functions. It promotes Th1 responses, inhibits Th17 development, and induces IL-10 production by regulatory T cells.

IL3.description: Interleukin-3 (multi-CSF) supports the growth and differentiation of multiple hematopoietic lineages. It is produced by activated T cells and promotes mast cell and basophil development.

IL36.description: IL-36 cytokines (IL-36α/β/γ) are IL-1 family members that promote inflammation in skin and lungs. They are implicated in psoriasis and other inflammatory skin conditions.

IL4.description: Interleukin-4 drives Th2 differentiation and IgE class switching. It promotes alternative macrophage activation and is central to allergic responses and helminth immunity.

IL6.description: Interleukin-6 is a pleiotropic cytokine with both pro- and anti-inflammatory effects. It regulates acute phase responses, immune regulation, and is elevated in inflammatory conditions.

LIF.description: Leukemia inhibitory factor is an IL-6 family cytokine that maintains stem cell pluripotency. It regulates implantation, inflammation, and neuronal development.

LTA.description: Lymphotoxin alpha (TNF-beta) is produced by lymphocytes and forms complexes with LTB. It is essential for lymphoid organ development and antimicrobial defense.

MCSF.description: Macrophage colony-stimulating factor promotes monocyte survival, proliferation, and differentiation into macrophages. It is important in osteoclast development and tissue macrophage homeostasis.

NO.description: Nitric oxide (from inducible NOS) is a gaseous signaling molecule with antimicrobial and vasodilatory effects. It is produced by activated macrophages and contributes to pathogen killing.

OSM.description: Oncostatin M is an IL-6 family cytokine that regulates cell growth, inflammation, and hematopoiesis. It is involved in liver regeneration, bone metabolism, and inflammatory diseases.

TGFB1.description: Transforming growth factor beta 1 regulates cell growth, differentiation, and immune function. It promotes regulatory T cell development and has both immunosuppressive and pro-fibrotic effects.

TGFB3.description: Transforming growth factor beta 3 is important in palatogenesis and wound healing. It promotes scarless healing and is involved in cardiovascular development.

TNFA.description: Tumor necrosis factor alpha is a pro-inflammatory cytokine produced mainly by macrophages. It regulates immune cells, induces fever, apoptosis, and is targeted in autoimmune disease therapy.

TRAIL.description: TNF-related apoptosis-inducing ligand selectively induces apoptosis in tumor cells. It is being developed as a cancer therapeutic due to its tumor-selective cytotoxicity.

TWEAK.description: TNF-like weak inducer of apoptosis regulates cell survival, proliferation, and inflammation. It is involved in tissue repair, angiogenesis, and inflammatory diseases.

VEGFA.description: Vascular endothelial growth factor A promotes angiogenesis and vascular permeability. It is key in development, wound healing, and tumor growth, and is targeted in cancer therapy.

WNT3A.description: Wnt3a activates canonical Wnt/beta-catenin signaling, regulating cell proliferation, differentiation, and stem cell maintenance. It is important in embryonic development and tissue homeostasis.

CCL2.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 2 (MCP-1) recruits monocytes, memory T cells, and dendritic cells to sites of inflammation. It is a key mediator in atherosclerosis and inflammatory diseases.

CCL3.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 3 (MIP-1α) attracts monocytes and T cells. It is produced during acute inflammation and viral infections and plays roles in HIV pathogenesis.

CCL4.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 4 (MIP-1β) recruits NK cells, monocytes, and other immune cells. It is a natural ligand for CCR5 and has anti-HIV activity.

CCL5.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 5 (RANTES) attracts T cells, eosinophils, and basophils. It plays roles in allergic inflammation, viral infections, and cancer progression.

CCL7.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 7 (MCP-3) recruits monocytes, eosinophils, and basophils. It is involved in allergic inflammation and wound healing responses.

CCL8.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 8 (MCP-2) attracts monocytes, lymphocytes, and eosinophils. It is induced by inflammatory stimuli and contributes to chronic inflammation.

CCL11.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 11 (Eotaxin-1) is a potent eosinophil chemoattractant. It plays key roles in allergic diseases including asthma and atopic dermatitis.

CCL17.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 17 (TARC) attracts Th2 cells and regulatory T cells. It is elevated in atopic dermatitis and serves as a disease activity biomarker.

CCL19.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 19 (MIP-3β) guides T cells and dendritic cells to lymph nodes. It is constitutively expressed in secondary lymphoid organs.

CCL20.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 20 (MIP-3α) recruits CCR6+ cells including Th17 cells and dendritic cells. It is important in mucosal immunity and autoimmune diseases.

CCL21.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 21 (SLC) guides naive T cells and dendritic cells to lymph nodes. It is expressed by lymphatic endothelial cells and stromal cells.

CCL22.description: C-C motif chemokine ligand 22 (MDC) attracts Th2 cells and regulatory T cells. It is produced by dendritic cells and macrophages and elevated in allergic diseases.

CXCL1.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 1 (GROα) is a potent neutrophil chemoattractant. It promotes angiogenesis and is involved in wound healing and tumor progression.

CXCL2.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 2 (GROβ) recruits neutrophils to sites of inflammation. It is produced by monocytes and macrophages during acute inflammation.

CXCL3.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 3 (GROγ) attracts neutrophils and promotes angiogenesis. It is induced by inflammatory cytokines and growth factors.

CXCL5.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 5 (ENA-78) recruits neutrophils and promotes angiogenesis. It is involved in inflammatory bowel disease and tumor progression.

CXCL6.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 6 (GCP-2) attracts neutrophils with antimicrobial activity. It is produced by epithelial cells and fibroblasts during inflammation.

CXCL8.description: Interleukin-8 (CXCL8) is a major neutrophil chemoattractant. It promotes neutrophil recruitment, activation, and degranulation during acute inflammation and infection.

CXCL9.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 9 (MIG) attracts activated T cells. It is induced by IFN-γ and promotes Th1 responses and antitumor immunity.

CXCL10.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 10 (IP-10) attracts activated T cells and NK cells. Induced by IFN-γ, it promotes Th1 responses and antiviral immunity.

CXCL11.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 11 (I-TAC) attracts activated T cells via CXCR3. It is induced by IFN-γ and IFN-β and promotes Th1-type inflammation.

CXCL13.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 13 (BCA-1) attracts B cells to lymphoid follicles. It is essential for germinal center formation and is elevated in autoimmune diseases.

CXCL14.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 14 (BRAK) has antimicrobial activity and regulates immune cell trafficking. It is constitutively expressed in epithelial tissues.

CXCL16.description: C-X-C motif chemokine ligand 16 exists in membrane-bound and soluble forms. It functions as a scavenger receptor and chemoattractant for CXCR6+ cells.

IL18.description: Interleukin-18 synergizes with IL-12 to induce IFN-γ production. It activates NK cells and Th1 responses and is activated by inflammasomes.

IL23A.description: Interleukin-23 (p19 subunit) maintains Th17 cell responses. It is important in mucosal immunity and implicated in autoimmune diseases like psoriasis.

IL33.description: Interleukin-33 is an alarmin released from damaged epithelial cells. It activates ILC2s, mast cells, and Th2 responses and is involved in allergic inflammation.

TSLP.description: Thymic stromal lymphopoietin is an epithelial cytokine that promotes Th2 inflammation. It is a key initiator of allergic responses in asthma and atopic dermatitis.

FLT3LG.description: Fms-related tyrosine kinase 3 ligand promotes dendritic cell development and expansion. It is used therapeutically to enhance dendritic cell vaccines.

KITLG.description: Kit ligand (Stem Cell Factor) supports hematopoietic stem cells, mast cells, and melanocytes. It is essential for normal hematopoiesis and gametogenesis.

PDGFA.description: Platelet-derived growth factor A promotes mesenchymal cell proliferation and migration. It is important in wound healing, development, and fibrotic diseases.

PDGFB.description: Platelet-derived growth factor B promotes cell proliferation, migration, and angiogenesis. It is involved in wound healing, atherosclerosis, and cancer progression.

SPP1.description: Osteopontin (SPP1) is a multifunctional protein involved in bone metabolism, immune regulation, and tumor progression. It promotes inflammation and cell survival.

SERPINE1.description: Plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 (PAI-1) regulates fibrinolysis and extracellular matrix remodeling. It is elevated in obesity, cardiovascular disease, and cancer.

MMP2.description: Matrix metalloproteinase 2 (Gelatinase A) degrades type IV collagen in basement membranes. It is important in tissue remodeling, angiogenesis, and tumor invasion.

MMP9.description: Matrix metalloproteinase 9 (Gelatinase B) is secreted by neutrophils and macrophages. It degrades extracellular matrix and is involved in inflammation and metastasis.

TIMP1.description: Tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinases 1 inhibits MMPs and regulates matrix remodeling. It has roles in cell growth, apoptosis, and is elevated in fibrosis.

TIMP2.description: Tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinases 2 regulates MMP activity and matrix turnover. It is involved in cell proliferation and has anti-angiogenic properties.

ANGPT1.description: Angiopoietin 1 stabilizes blood vessels and promotes endothelial survival. It signals through Tie2 receptor and is important in vascular development.

ANGPT2.description: Angiopoietin 2 destabilizes vessels and promotes angiogenesis in the presence of VEGF. It is elevated in cancer, sepsis, and inflammatory conditions.

EPO.description: Erythropoietin stimulates red blood cell production in response to hypoxia. It is used therapeutically for anemia in chronic kidney disease and cancer.

THPO.description: Thrombopoietin regulates platelet production by megakaryocytes. It is essential for platelet homeostasis and is used to treat thrombocytopenia.

GH1.description: Growth hormone stimulates growth, cell reproduction, and metabolism. It acts through IGF-1 and is used therapeutically for growth disorders.

IGF1.description: Insulin-like growth factor 1 mediates many effects of growth hormone. It promotes cell growth, differentiation, and survival and is implicated in aging and cancer.

IGF2.description: Insulin-like growth factor 2 is important in fetal growth and development. It is an imprinted gene and overexpression is associated with certain cancers.

INS.description: Insulin regulates glucose uptake and metabolism. It is essential for blood glucose control, and deficiency or resistance causes diabetes mellitus.

LEP.description: Leptin is secreted by adipocytes and regulates energy balance and appetite. It signals satiety to the brain and is involved in immunity and reproduction.

ADIPOQ.description: Adiponectin is an adipokine with insulin-sensitizing and anti-inflammatory properties. Low levels are associated with obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular disease.

RETN.description: Resistin is an adipokine linked to insulin resistance and inflammation. It is elevated in obesity and may contribute to metabolic syndrome.

PRL.description: Prolactin primarily regulates lactation but also has immunomodulatory functions. It promotes T cell proliferation and is elevated in some autoimmune diseases.

GDF15.description: Growth differentiation factor 15 is a stress-responsive cytokine that regulates appetite and energy metabolism. It is elevated in cancer, heart failure, and aging.

PTH.description: Parathyroid hormone regulates calcium and phosphate homeostasis. It promotes bone resorption and is used therapeutically for osteoporosis.

CALCA.description: Calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP) is a potent vasodilator and neurotransmitter. It is involved in migraine pathophysiology and is targeted by new migraine drugs.

POMC.description: Pro-opiomelanocortin is a precursor for ACTH, MSH, and beta-endorphin. It regulates stress response, pigmentation, and energy homeostasis.

SAA1.description: Serum amyloid A1 is a major acute phase protein produced during inflammation. Chronic elevation can lead to amyloidosis in inflammatory diseases.

CRP.description: C-reactive protein is an acute phase protein and inflammatory biomarker. It activates complement and is used clinically to monitor inflammation and infection.

LBP.description: Lipopolysaccharide binding protein facilitates LPS recognition by CD14 and TLR4. It is an acute phase protein important in antibacterial host defense.

HP.description: Haptoglobin binds free hemoglobin to prevent oxidative damage. It is an acute phase protein elevated during inflammation and decreased in hemolysis.

FN1.description: Fibronectin is a glycoprotein that connects cells to extracellular matrix. It is important in wound healing, embryonic development, and cell migration.

LGALS3.description: Galectin-3 regulates cell adhesion, inflammation, and fibrosis. It is elevated in heart failure and is a biomarker for cardiovascular disease.

B2M.description: Beta-2 microglobulin is a component of MHC class I molecules. It is a marker of immune activation and elevated in inflammatory and malignant conditions.

APOE.description: Apolipoprotein E mediates lipid transport and metabolism. The APOE4 allele is a major genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease.

APOA1.description: Apolipoprotein A1 is the major protein component of HDL. It promotes cholesterol efflux and has anti-inflammatory and anti-atherosclerotic properties.

PLG.description: Plasminogen is converted to plasmin, which degrades fibrin clots. It is essential for fibrinolysis and tissue remodeling processes.

F2.description: Prothrombin (Factor II) is converted to thrombin, which converts fibrinogen to fibrin. It is essential for blood clotting and wound healing.

PROC.description: Protein C is an anticoagulant that inactivates factors Va and VIIIa. Deficiency leads to thrombophilia and increased clotting risk.

PROS1.description: Protein S is a cofactor for activated protein C in anticoagulation. It also has direct anti-inflammatory effects independent of coagulation.

ANXA1.description: Annexin A1 has anti-inflammatory and pro-resolving properties. It mediates glucocorticoid effects and promotes resolution of inflammation.

S100A8.description: S100A8 (Calgranulin A) forms a complex with S100A9 called calprotectin. It is released by neutrophils and is a biomarker for inflammatory diseases.

S100A9.description: S100A9 (Calgranulin B) forms calprotectin with S100A8. It activates TLR4 and RAGE and is elevated in infections and autoimmune diseases.

S100A12.description: S100A12 (Calgranulin C) is a proinflammatory alarmin released by granulocytes. It is elevated in inflammatory diseases and infections.

HMGB1.description: High mobility group box 1 is a nuclear protein and alarmin. When released extracellularly, it promotes inflammation through TLR4 and RAGE signaling.

LCN2.description: Lipocalin 2 (NGAL) sequesters iron to limit bacterial growth. It is an acute phase protein and biomarker for kidney injury.

CHI3L1.description: Chitinase 3-like 1 (YKL-40) is involved in inflammation and tissue remodeling. It is elevated in asthma, liver fibrosis, and various cancers.

CTLA4.description: Cytotoxic T-lymphocyte associated protein 4 is an immune checkpoint that inhibits T cell activation. It is targeted by checkpoint inhibitor immunotherapy.

PDCD1.description: Programmed cell death protein 1 (PD-1) is an immune checkpoint receptor on T cells. Anti-PD-1 antibodies are used in cancer immunotherapy.

CD274.description: PD-L1 (CD274) is a ligand for PD-1 expressed by tumor cells and immune cells. It suppresses T cell activity and is targeted in cancer immunotherapy.

FASLG.description: Fas ligand induces apoptosis through Fas receptor. It is important in immune homeostasis, cytotoxic killing, and immune privilege.

PRF1.description: Perforin forms pores in target cell membranes allowing granzyme entry. It is essential for cytotoxic T cell and NK cell-mediated killing.

GZMA.description: Granzyme A is a serine protease that induces caspase-independent cell death. It is released by cytotoxic lymphocytes to kill target cells.

GZMB.description: Granzyme B is a serine protease that activates caspases and induces apoptosis. It is the major effector molecule of cytotoxic lymphocytes.

TREM2.description: Triggering receptor expressed on myeloid cells 2 regulates microglial function. Variants are associated with Alzheimer's disease risk.

CD163.description: CD163 is a hemoglobin-haptoglobin scavenger receptor on macrophages. Soluble CD163 is elevated in inflammatory conditions and liver disease.

MRC1.description: Mannose receptor C type 1 (CD206) is expressed on alternatively activated macrophages. It mediates pathogen recognition and antigen uptake.

CLEC7A.description: Dectin-1 is a pattern recognition receptor that recognizes fungal beta-glucans. It activates antifungal immune responses in macrophages and dendritic cells.

ICAM1.description: Intercellular adhesion molecule 1 mediates leukocyte adhesion and transmigration. It is upregulated on endothelium during inflammation.

VCAM1.description: Vascular cell adhesion molecule 1 mediates leukocyte adhesion to endothelium. It is important in inflammatory cell recruitment and atherosclerosis.

SELE.description: E-selectin is expressed on activated endothelium and mediates leukocyte rolling. It is important for neutrophil recruitment during inflammation.

SELP.description: P-selectin is expressed on activated endothelium and platelets. It mediates initial leukocyte rolling and platelet-leukocyte interactions.
